answers.answer: With your history and concern, it sounds like you've already made up your mind to stay home. Your health and your baby's come before work. They'll manage. It's better to stay safe and healthy. Best wishes mama
Thanks I just wanted to state the facts but I know my child is more important

I think you should listen to your body. If you feel ok working then work but if you are having pains or it doesn't feel right then don't do it! My doctor just told me the same thing today but I'm 35 weeks and also a high risk pregnancy because of type 2 diabetes and preeclampsia. She said if you can work then work but if not listen to your body and don't push yourself.

question: I'm high risk and my doctor said it's ok as long as I want too.So should I go?My job consists of a lot of standing,bending and twisting.They don't have enough ppl to cover the workload.I have came this far and I dont want to lose her.I have suffered from two loses and this is the furthest I've came I'm 25 weeks 3 days.Any suggestions
title: so should I go back to work???
